sense.name: release from confinement
sense.examples: The prisoners' daring escape was described in the newspaper. The horse made an easy escape by jumping the fence. He said there was no escape from this world except death. (metaphoric extension)

sense.name: a diversion from some unpleasant reality
sense.examples: Her main escape was watching daily soap operas. The vacation was to be an escape from his dreary, monotonous office job. Work became his only escape from worry and depression.

sense.name: the leakage of a substance
sense.examples: The explosion was caused by the escape of flammable gas from a broken pipe. John poured the freshly brewed coffee into a thermos to prevent the escape of the volatile flavors.

sense.name: mechanism that is a safety valve
sense.examples: The steam boiler has an escape that opens automatically when the pressure builds to a certain level.

sense.name: the avoidance of some adversity, danger or unpleasantness
sense.examples: The couple had a narrow escape from injury. There is no escape at this point from filling out the tedious tax returns. (can no longer avoid it)

sense.name: location serving the role of an exit
sense.examples: The fire code requires that the room have two routes of escape from it. The burglar climbed up the fire escape. The underground tunnel was a secret escape for the royal family.

sense.name: a cultivated plant that is now growing wild
sense.examples: The white flowers along the road here are probably escapes from the botanical garden. The untended pineapple escapes were small and bug-infested.

sense.name: an interrupter key on a computer keyboard
sense.examples: Hit escape to stop the application. Where is the escape key located on your keyboard?
